channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13370] PE tool could give option for using Explicit Column Tracker which leads to seeks
item.description: Currently in PE tool all the scans and gets adds explicitly the columns to be scanned. The tool by default adds only one Qualifier. Doing this addColumns leads to Explicit Column Tracker which does seeks frequently. If we want to know a simple scan performance as a basic scenario then we should have the option to add this columns explicitly.
item.summary: PE tool could give option for using Explicit Column Tracker which leads to seeks

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch that enables adding the columns through an option --addColumns. Changing this I could see in the profiler that we avoid the calls to StoreScanner.seekAsDirection().

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12708606/HBASE-13370.patch
against master branch at commit ffdcc0095232caf7dc98448abb6ff57b0333e962.

This message is automatically generated.
This would be useful in testing basic scan and get scenarios. Any chance of a review here?

Though I'm not well versed with PE tool, this change looks simple. And my guess is that warnings by QA Bot have nothing to do with this issue.
+1 lgtm.

Couple of trivial things which you can fix while pushing the changes. Please move this block


+      final String addColumns = "--addColumns=";

+      if (cmd.startsWith(addColumns)) {

+        opts.addColumns = Boolean.parseBoolean(cmd.substring(addColumns.length()));

+        continue;

+      }

to before if (isCommandClass(cmd)) block to group all options together and also you might want to leave space before true in Default:true.

Updated patch addressing the comments. Thanks for the review.
Will commit this unless objections.
Stack
You could use this in your PE tests in case you need to see the difference between multiple seeks done by the same client. JFYI. Thanks.

Looks like this block is missing in latest patch.


+      final String addColumns = "--addColumns=";

+      if (cmd.startsWith(addColumns)) {

+        opts.addColumns = Boolean.parseBoolean(cmd.substring(addColumns.length()));

+        continue;

+      }

And also, this should Default : true -> Default: true as per conventions being followed in PE.
Thanks for the watchful eyes. I moved the code but before I took a patch it got undone in my IDE.

Go for it, Ram! RAT warnings are related to HBASE-12975.

Pushed to master. Thanks for the review Srikanth Srungarapu.
Need this in the branch-1 also Enis Soztutar?

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6336 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6336/)
HBASE-13370 - PE tool could give option for using Explicit Column Tracker (unknown: rev f210c2ebba31dd79ffdf819a2c5e45dcd5a36ace)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/PerformanceEvaluation.java

You could use this in your PE tests in case you need to see the difference between multiple seeks done by the same client. JFYI. Thanks.

Tell me more ramkrishna.s.vasudevan How would it effect scan1000 say?

Currently PE tool does addColumn and it adds the only Column family and the qualifier explicitly. This makes the Explicit ColumnTracker to be used. It will internally make the store scanner to seek before deciding there is no additional columns for that row. StoreScanner.seekAsDirection(). This patch would avoid addColumns so internally this seek would be reduced. You can see a minor change in the profiler as to how many different APIs call the blockSeek now.

How would it effect scan1000 say?

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan

See above.

And my PE has ten columns so how would it help here? Thanks.

Just seeing this latest comment,
Your PE has 10 columns? So is that a modified version of the PE? Because by default when we do sequentialWrite it writes data with one Column.
So am not sure what is your scan1000 doing. Is it again customised? RandomScanWithRange10000Test by default adds a the default family and qualifier explicitly thus every time leading to additional seek due to the explicit column tracker. This change would help you in making that addColumn configurable thus reducing one more seek.
Will close this JIRA with fixed version as 2.0 only?

IIRC we're trying to keep PE in sync across active branches as much as possible, makes it easier to find regressions across releases. So please back port to at least branch-1 and 0.98 (FYI: Andrew Purtell). This isn't a bug fix, but it's also a change to "test code", so I think it's okay to back port to branch-1.0. Enis Soztutar you disagree?

This isn't a bug fix, but it's also a change to "test code", so I think it's okay to back port

Agreed, +1 for 0.98
Patch for branch-1. The trunk patch does not apply cleanly on branch-1.
Patch for 0.98.
Pushed to branch-1 and 0.98 also. Thanks for the head up folks. Will resolve issue now.
